info.name: Qoyod API
info.description:
Overview

Qoyod's API consists of 19 resource types, expect responses to be in json.

Resources in the current version are:

  1. Accounts

  2. Products

  3. Inventories

  4. Product Categories

  5. Product Units

  6. Vendors

  7. Purchase Orders

  8. Bills

  9. Bill Payments

  10. Simple Bills

  11. Simple Bill Payments

  12. Debit Notes

  13. Customers

  14. Quotes

  15. Invoices

  16. Invoice Payments

  17. Credit Notes

  18. Receipts

  19. Journal Entries

Authentication

All requests in this api require an API-KEY header, this can be generated from your General Settings page. Once you generate your API key, save your settings and try out our API.

Error Codes

Expect typical HTTP response codes, 200, 201, 400, 404, 500, ...

Searching and Sorting

All index endpoints use ransack for searching and sorting by any parameter.
Default sorting is by "id asc".

The below example searches for products with sku containing "acc", sorted by buying_price desc:

https://www.qoyod.com/api/2.0/products?q[sku_cont]=acc&q[s]=buying_price+desc

A complete list of search terms can be found here

  5. receive_payments(required): "true" or "false", allows or disallows creating receipts with this account

  6. type(required): must be one of the types listed below

Account Types are as follows:

  • Asset types:

    • FixedAsset

    • CurrentAsset

    • Bank

    • Cash

    • Inventory

  • Liability Types:

    • Liability

    • CurrentLiability

    • NoncurrentLiability

  • Expense Types:

    • Depreciation

    • DirectCost

    • Expense

    • Overhead

  • Equity Types:

    • Equity

  • Revenue Types:

    • OtherIncome

    • Revenue

    • Sale

  5. description(required)
  6. line_items(required)
    1. product_id(required)

request.description:
Parameters

  1. SKU(required, unique): the SKU of the product, must be unique.
  2. barcode(optional)
  3. name_ar(required): product arabic name.
  4. name_en(required): product english name.
  5. description(optional)
  6. product_unit_type_id(required): The base unit id of the product.
  7. category_id(required): The category id of the product.
  8. track_quantity(optional): Is this product an inventory item? Set 1 for true, otherwise remove it or set it to 0.
  9. purchase_item: enter 1 if you buy the product, leave it empty or zero otherwise.
  10. buying_price: the price you buy the product for, only required if purchase_item is true
  11. expense_account_id: the cost of goods sold or purchases account where the cost is registered, only required if purchase_item is true
  12. sale_item: enter 1 if you sell the product, leave it empty or zero otherwise.
  13. selling_price: the price you sell the product for, only required if sale_item is true
  14. sales_account_id: the sales account where the sales revenue is registered, only required if sale_item is true
  15. tax_id(required): Enter one of the following default choices, or you can create your own taxes by going to the tax settings page:
    1. 1: 15% VAT
    2. 2: 0% VAT
    3. 3: Tax exempt
  16. special_tax_reason_id : only for use when tax is "Zero" or "Exempt"
    1. In case tax is "Zero"
      1. 1 : Export of goods
      2. 2 : Export of services
      3. 3 : Qualifying metals
      4. 4 : Private education to citizen
      5. 5 : Private healthcare to citizen
      6. 6 : Medicines and medical equipment
      7. 7 : International transport of Goods
      8. 8 : International transport of passengers
      9. 9 : Supply of a qualifying means of transport
      10. 10 : Services relating to Goods or passenger transportation
      11. 11 : Services directly connected to supply of international passenger transport
    2. In case tax is "Exempt"
      1. 12 : Financial services
      2. 13 : Life insurance services
      3. 14 : Real estate transactions
  17. type(optional): Enter one of the following choices, defaults to "Product":
    1. "Product"
    2. "Service"
    3. "Expense"
    4. "RawMaterial"
    5. "Recipe"
  18. ingredients_attributes: only for use if type is "Recipe"
    1. component_id: the product id of the ingredient
    2. unit_id: unit id of the ingredient
    3. quantity: how much of the ingredient is needed to make 1 recipe
  19. unit_conversions(optional): Each product can have multiple units other than the base unit specified above in parameter #6:
    1. from_unit(required): the new unit you would like to add
    2. rate(required): 1 x from_unit = rate x base_unit
    3. unit_purchase_price(optional)
    4. unit_selling_price(optional)
    5. barcode(optional)

request.description:
Enter only the parameters you wish to change.

Please consider the following:
- Cannot update inventory status of the product (tracked or not) if the product is involved already in any invoices/bills
- Cannot update stock quantities directly (use inventory adjustments).
- Cannot update `product unit type` if the product is involved already in any invoices/bills
- Cannot update `sales account` if the product is involved already in any invoices/bills
- Cannot update `purchase account` if the product is not tracked (not an inventory item) and a buying price is already defined
- `cogs account` cannot be empty if the product is tracked (marked as an inventory item)

Parameters

  1. SKU

  2. barcode

  3. name_ar

  4. name_en

  5. description

  6. category_id

  7. ingredients_attributes: only for use if type is "Recipe"

    1. component_id: the product id of the ingredient

    2. unit_id: unit id of the ingredient

    3. quantity: how much of the ingredient is needed to make 1 recipe

  8. unit_conversions

    1. from_unit(required): the new unit you would like to add

    2. rate(required): 1 x from_unit = rate x base_unit

request.description:
Parameters

  1. contact_id(required): The id of the vendor you are purchasing from.
  2. issue_date(required): The issue date of the purchase order, format: yyyy-mm-dd
  3. expiry_date(required): The due date of the purchase order, format: yyyy-mm-dd
  4. status(required): The status of the purchase order, can be Draft or Approved
  5. inventory_id(required)
  6. notes(optional)
  7. terms_conditions(optional)
  8. line_items: An array of line items, each line item follows this format:
    1. product_id(required)
    2. unit_type(optional): unit type id of the product, defaults to the product's default unit type.
    3. description(optional)
    4. quantity(required)
    5. unit_price(required)
    6. discount(optional)
    7. discount_type(optional): determines whether the discount above is a percentage or an amount, can be percentage or amount, defaults to percentage
    8. tax_percent(optional)
    9. is_inclusive(optional): set to true if the entered unit price is tax inclusive, defaults to false
  9. custom_fields(optional): Array of custom fields and their values to add to the purchase order, custom fields must already be added in the website's settings page

Parameters

  1. contact_id(required): The id of the vendor you are buying from.
  2. status(required): The status of the bill, can be Draft or Approved.
  3. issue_date(required): The issue date of the bill, format: yyyy-mm-dd.
  4. due_date(required): The due date of the bill, format: yyyy-mm-dd.
  5. reference(optional, unique): A unique reference for the bill, will be autogenerated if not sent.
  6. inventory_id(required)
  7. line_items(required): An array of line items in the bill, each line item follows this format:
    1. product_id(required)
    2. description(optional)
    3. quantity(required)
    4. unit_price(required)
    5. unit_type(optional): unit type id of the product, defaults to the product's default unit type.
    6. discount(optional)
    7. discount_type(optional): determines whether the discount above is a percentage or an amount, can be percentage or amount, defaults to percentage
    8. tax_percent(optional)
    9. is_inclusive(optional): set to true if the entered unit price is tax inclusive, defaults to false
  8. custom_fields(optional): Array of custom fields and their values to add to the bill, custom fields must already be added in the website's settings page

request.description:
URL Parameters

  1. /:id

Parameters

  1. contact_id(required): The id of the vendor you are returning the products to
  2. reference (optional, unique): will be autogenerated if not sent.
  3. issue_date(required): The issue date - format: yyyy-mm-dd
  4. status(required): The status can be Draft or Approved
  5. inventory_id(required)
  6. terms_conditions(optional)
  7. notes(optional)
  8. draft_if_out_of_stock(optional): If one or more of the products do not have enough quantity, create the Debit Note as "Draft" instead of returning an error.
  9. line_items: An array of line items, each line item follows this format:
    1. product_id(required)
    2. description(optional)
    3. unit_price(required)
    4. quantity(required)
    5. unit_type(optional): unit type id of the product, defaults to the product's default unit type.
    6. discount(optional)
    7. discount_type(optional): determines whether the discount above is a percentage or an amount, can be percentage or amount, defaults to percentage
    8. tax_percent(optional)
  10. custom_fields(optional): Array of custom fields and their values to add to the debit note, custom fields must already be added in the website's settings page

  3. phone_number(optional)

  5. email(optional)

  6. status(optional): "Active" or "Inactive", defaults to "Active".

  7. tax_number(optional)

  8. shipping_address (optional)

  9. billing_address (optional)

request.description:
Parameters

  1. contact_id(required): The id of the customer you are selling to
  2. quotation_number(required, unique)
  3. issue_date(required): The issue date of the quote, format: yyyy-mm-dd
  4. expiry_date(required): The due date of the quote, format: yyyy-mm-dd
  5. status(required): The status of the quote, can be Draft or Approved, defaults to draft
  6. terms_conditions(optional)
  7. notes(optional)
  8. inventory_id(required)
  9. line_items: An array of line items, each line item follows this format:
    1. product_id(required)
    2. description(optional)
    3. quantity(required)
    4. unit_price(required)
    5. unit_type(optional): unit type id of the product, defaults to the product's default unit type.
    6. discount(optional)
    7. discount_type(optional): determines whether the discount above is a percentage or an amount, can be percentage or amount, defaults to percentage
    8. tax_percent(optional)
    9. is_inclusive(optional): set to true if the entered unit price is tax inclusive, defaults to false
  10. custom_fields(optional): Array of custom fields and their values to add to the quote, custom fields must already be added in the website's settings page

request.description:
URL Parameters

  1. /:id

URL Parameters

  1. /:id

Parameters

  1. contact_id(required): The id of the contact you want to sell to

  2. reference(optional, unique): will be autogenerated if not sent.

  3. description(optional)

  4. issue_date(required): The issue date of the invoice, format: yyyy-mm-dd

  5. due_date(required): The due date of the invoice, format: yyyy-mm-dd

  6. status(required): The status of the invoice, can be Draft or Approved, defaults to draft

  7. inventory_id(required): The inventory where this product belongs, required.

  8. draft_if_out_of_stock(optional): If one or more of the products do not have enough quantity, create the invoice as "Draft" instead of returning an error.

  9. line_items(required): An array of line items in the invoice, each line item follows this format:

    1. product_id(required)

    2. description(optional)

    3. quantity(required): Products that are tracked (marked as inventory items) cannot be used in invoices if current stock does not have enough quantity

    4. unit_price(required)

    5. unit_type(optional): unit type id of the product, defaults to the product's default unit type..

    6. discount(optional)

    7. discount_type(optional): determines whether the discount above is a percentage or an amount, can be percentage or amount, defaults to percentage

    8. tax_percent(optional)

    9. is_inclusive(optional): set to true if the entered unit price is tax inclusive, defaults to false

  10. custom_fields(optional): Array of custom fields and their values to add to the invoice, custom fields must already be added in the website's settings page

    1. account_id(required): the account you want to debit
